alert.note: Alert for Morrill (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 4:42AM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Morrill County through 415 AM MDT... At 342 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Alliance Airport to 17 miles east of Angora to 6 miles northeast of The Intersection Of Highway 385 And 92. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Morrill County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
